website_summaries.verdict: The ReadyNAS range is a perfect addition to a household that needs not just storage, but control over that storage. Now if only Netgear could do something about the price.

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, cheap, no frills, use it for rsyncing everything
customer_reviews.text: Basic NAS; pretty dated now and the photo media sharing app was really pretty lame. However I use it regularly with rsync, plus a couple of added USB drives for additional safety. Good diagnostics and email - warned be of read errors on my main mirrored drive - so replace it and all's well. Best part is when I travel for any length of time this will fit in my safety deposit box.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Best buy for the buck
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit after buying another NAS and wasted an entire weekend trying to get it up and running. This unit could not have been easier. The only mistake I made was installing both drives before performing the "factory reset" to clear my Windows formatted drives. After I removed the second drive, held the backup button, used my paperclip to press the reset button on the back, it took care of everything. Once the first drive was set, I simply added the second drive while it was running and it went into rebuild mode. On my gigabit network this thing runs faster than my connected USB drive.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Best NAS I have ever had
customer_reviews.text: I love Netgear routers and now I respect them even more because compared to the WD NAS I use to have this is easier to setup. Best feature to me is that the NAS emails me when there is a update. I have 2 Western Digital Caviar Green 3 TB SATA III 64 MB Cache in it (just in case someone wants to know)
customer_reviews.author: Rouel Jones

customer_reviews.title: great debian server
customer_reviews.text: Since this little box runs straight debian linux under the hood it's very powerful. I'm using it not only as a NAS at work to back up our machines, but also as the DHCP/DNS server, openvpn server, network monitoring device, etc. And if hacking your NAS doesn't interest you, it also performs very nicely as a stand-alone NAS with a simple web interface.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to set up with 2 each 3TB drives in raid 1. Let it do it's thing, then just copies 600+ movies onto it. Let that run overnight. Works great with my WD TV LIVE units.
customer_reviews.author: djk123

customer_reviews.title: Nice system to back up files on.
customer_reviews.text: I use it to backup information on several PC's. The software is rather hard to work with but it meets my needs for backing up systems. Great for anyone that has lost data they needed to retrieve.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Prefer X86
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Netgear because of all its add ons. However, I quickly realized that the Duo doesn't run on the x86 intel chip and thus many of the better add ons also don't run on this netgear model. However, I use this NAS box as a backup to my x86 Ultra Plus. It works great and has never given me an issue for how I have used it so I have no complaints there. If you are only looking for storage, this will do an excellent job. However, if you want more add ons and some server power, you should cough up the extra dough for the Ultra series.
customer_reviews.author: CJC

customer_reviews.title: it works now.. ..but
customer_reviews.text: It now works but is a true pain to get the software set up. I spent 2 hours on the fone with a very nice tech to find there was a server reg problem. The nas remote sw fone app is truly crap
customer_reviews.author: Dusty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect In Every Way
customer_reviews.text: Item was delivered in perfect condition, and works wonderfully. Shipping was fast and well packaged. The unit did take some time to get set up, but that was to be expected as it has an auto-update feature when powered on. Excellent transfer rate and works great for my nightly backups.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Parker

customer_reviews.title: Great NAS
customer_reviews.text: This NAS is really tiny, but very easy to set-up and use. You have to access it manually, but it's just straight-forward. No noise, no heat. What's not to like.
customer_reviews.author: Olivier & Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This NAS really ties the home network nicely...including live music streaming through Logitech Squeezebox. File transfer is fast through USB3. Its like having a 4Gb hard drive in each computer in the house. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Nash M

customer_reviews.title: Solid Performer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to expand my NAS backup capability and use ReadyNAS Photos II to share my pictures. Unit is quiet and performs as advertised. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: JLouisIII

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I had to then sold it... for the Asustor,... it the best
customer_reviews.author: Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: Buy a cheaper netgear without the USB 3 ports
customer_reviews.text: Great unit, but the USB 3 ports are a joke
customer_reviews.author: Kamoola

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for just about three months now it is quiet and rock solid. Functions very well have only rebooted one time.
customer_reviews.author: OldenOne

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, great price. CON: software is kinda lame, really could use some work there, but I was able to get everything done.
customer_reviews.author: SuwaneeSQLGuy

customer_reviews.title: Not ready for market!
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to use it ONLY for simple LAN bkup then OK. Otherwise to many bugs and does not have the features advertised unless you run their Beta firmware. The Synology is the best. IT Admin.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Performs flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I would change is the fact that it doesn't turn itself back on after a power outage. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun M. Glazier

customer_reviews.title: NetGear ReadyNAS
customer_reviews.text: This unit has become the backbone of my home network. I use it store all of our family pictures, files and software. I also use it store weekly and monthy backups for all my PC's. I have it configured with with (2) 2TB Western Digital Drives. I recommend it to anyone in need of a large network storage device.
customer_reviews.author: Hector

customer_reviews.title: not a device for everyone
customer_reviews.text: This device has a misleading device configuration. the device will only use special hard drive. The hard drives that it will use are the expensive ones. The device is not clearly stated so you know what you are getting. you think you can use standard hard drive and find out that you must search for these unique drive that you can not find in normal stores. I have been working with computers for years, repairing and building them. this is a device that even gave me problem. I would stay away from this device.
customer_reviews.author: Morris Donald

customer_reviews.title: Be patient
customer_reviews.text: Work to anyone that is buying the disk-less version be patient. I destroyed a 3TB WD drive because I pulled it out as it was formatting. The ReadyNas works great and is easy to setup.
customer_reviews.author: poolsb

customer_reviews.title: Affordable NAS
customer_reviews.text: I have read multiple bad reviews about this product but found most of these users can resolve their issues by simply reading the instructions (found on Netgears website). I'm happy with my setup experience and the NAS user interface. Honestly, these types of products are for advanced users, even hints at it in the product description. Overall, Netgear did a good job creating a product for the intended audience. I docked a star because I have used other NAS devices in the past which did not require the installation of software (aka bloatware) to get the device to function. I would rate 4 1/2 stars but Amazon gives no option for that.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: they work great if one of the drives fail
customer_reviews.text: My readynas stopped working - can't access any of my files although I am able to see it in raidar. Can't find it on my network. Now how the hell am I supposed to get files of my 2 perfectly working drives? They use their own proprietary raid. One thing about Nas in general, they work great if one of the drives fail, just swap the drive. But, happens when the Nas dies? Your out of luck and can't get to any of your files on the disks.
customer_reviews.author: Huy N.

customer_reviews.title: My first NAS - 2 years in now
customer_reviews.text: I've owned my ReadyNas Duo v1 for 2 years, 4 months. It has always performed flawlessly. I use it for DLNA for my two WDTV Live units as well as for back-up and storage for my desktop and laptop. It just always works. I have had one drive to give fault errors about 1.5 years into service. Popped a new hard-drive in and it automatically started to rebuild. Configured as RAID 1 with two 2TB WD Green Drives.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisInCO

customer_reviews.title: Runs like a champ!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Awesome NAS! I have had 2 3tb drives in it for probably 5 or more years and it works like a champ. I use it as storage for my plex server. I am running out of space and need to upgrade capacity. I would love to have another, but will probably upgrade to a newer veraion.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: amazing device
customer_reviews.text: I am a NETGEARSuperFan and this is an awesome storage device with so much capacity memory wise. I always used a regular external hard drive to manually back up my files. With this I just set it on automatic and backups everything immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R.

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a huge IT techie person but this readyNAS was easy to set up. The software seemed to be pretty easy to use also and I just set up some backups and that was pretty much it. I don't know enough to talk about all the technical stuff on this but I just know that it works which is really all most people care about.
customer_reviews.author: Bearcat

customer_reviews.title: All things Netgear
customer_reviews.text: The other reviewers comments were spot on. particulary, "dont call netgear unless your a glutton for punishment" this applies across the board for all netgear products. its a nightmare. Same for product representations - many "features" don't work as advertised. readynas remote, usb 3, or usb backup.... all miserable failures. Great potential, poor execution and support. D-link has similar support. I found paying the extra money for Cisco business products will save you hundreds in lost hrs trying to get netgear products to perform the way the are supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: 20 Year Tech

customer_reviews.title: Excellent affordable basic NAS for RAID-1
customer_reviews.text: I had no trouble installing the disks, setting it up, and migrating everything over from my old IOmega StoreCenter NAS. Because of prior experience, I knew what I wanted to do and could find the features I needed in their attractive user interface. Admittedly, some things are not documented, such as the need to reset the permissions on shares after using rsync. But it was in the GUI, and fairly obvious. I've not tried any advanced features. It's an outstanding value even as a basic NAS.
customer_reviews.author: frank j webster

customer_reviews.title: Pretty bad
customer_reviews.text: I run a software company. I can handle technically challenging installations. I got it to work for a minute, then it went down. Then it filled up, so I tried to upgrade the drives, and the new drives weren't compatible. Basically it's nearly unusable for me 1 yr after investing about $500 in setup.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

product_meta.title: Netgear RND2000-200 ReadyNAS Duo v2 Diskless 2-Bay/USB 3.0 Network Storage for Home/SoHo Users - Latest Generation
product_meta.description:
Style:ReadyNAS Duo, Diskless (0TB)ReadyNAS Duo v2 enables Home/SoHo users to create their own private cloud so they can access their music, photos, videos, and documents from anywhere in the world. Twice as fast as the previous generation, ReadyNAS Duo v2 features a 1.6 GHz processor and two new USB 3.0 ports. It also features a new RAIDiator 5 user interface and an enhanced ReadyNAS Photos II photo-sharing application. Compatibility: Game console, Mac, PC, Unix

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


ADVANCED PERFORMANCE FOR HOME NETWORKS 
ReadyNAS Duo v2 allows the creation of your own private cloud for accessing music, photos, videos, and documents from anywhere in the world. Featuring a streamlined interface optimized for the home user, these second generation products are equipped with a 1.6 GHz CPU for faster processing and in an industry first, two USB 3.0 ports for improved transfer rates. 

The NETGEAR Difference – ReadyNAS Duo v2 * Peerless Simplicity
 * 
 * Optimum Price and Performance
 * 
 * Painless Service and Support
 * 

Applications * Photos II – Private photo sharing 
 * 
 * ReadyNAS Remote – Access files from mobile device 
 * 
 * Transmission – Bit torrent client
 * 

SIMPLICITY
 *  Easy-To-Use – Complete set-up in less than 8 clicks 
 * 
 *  Expandable – Hot-swappable drives for zero downtime expansion
 * 
 *  Manage Remotely – Secure access from mobile devices 
 * 

PERFORMANCE
 *  Backup Speed – Powerful processor and USB 3.0 for fast backup
 * 
 *  Share – Manage and safely share photos
 * 
 * Media Server – DLNA compatible for media streaming

SUPPORT
 *  App Library – Active add-on community (ReadyNAS.com) 
 * 
 *  Unmatched Support – Technical support by phone and 3-year warranty
 * 
 *  Market Leader – #1 network storage vendor in the world
 *

TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS
PACKAGE CONTENTS

BACKUP

USB DEVICE SUPPORT

ReadyNAS Photos II: Private photo-sharing app (HD support)
ReadyNAS ReadyDLNA: DLNA media streaming app
ReadyNAS X-RAID2: Automatic RAID management and expansion
